# Chord: Major 7th in F# (Shape: A)

## Description
The Major 7th chord in the key of F# (using the A shape on the guitar) consists of the notes F#, A#, C#, and E#. This chord is made up of the root note F#, the major third A#, the perfect fifth C#, and the major 7th E#. It has a rich and jazzy sound, often used to add a sophisticated and lush quality to music.

## Intervals
- Root (F#)
- Major 3rd (A#)
- Perfect 5th (C#)
- Major 7th (E#)

## Musical Flavor
The Major 7th chord in F# (using the A shape) imparts a dreamy and luxurious feel to music. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and soul genres to create a sense of warmth and elegance in compositions. The Major 7th chord in F# (A shape) is versatile and can evoke emotions ranging from relaxation to contemplation.

## Songs
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra** - This classic jazz standard features the Major 7th chord in various keys, including F#.
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - The Major 7th chord in F# adds a smooth and sophisticated touch to this soulful pop song.
3. **"Corcovado" by Antonio Carlos Jobim** - This bossa nova tune prominently uses the Major 7th chord in F# to create a laid-back and melodic atmosphere.
